meanings.definition: To remove a muzzle from (a dog)
meanings.sent1: She was unmuzzling her dog before the walk.
meanings.sent2: The kind owner was unmuzzling the playful puppy.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed relieved after the unmuzzling.
meanings.sent4: With the unmuzzling, the dog's happiness was unleashed.
meanings.sent5: The act of unmuzzling made the dog wag its tail joyfully.

meanings.definition: To allow freedom of speech or expression
meanings.sent1: The government was unmuzzling the journalists to report freely.
meanings.sent2: Unmuzzling the citizens led to open discussions.
meanings.sent3: The unmuzzling of opinions brought new ideas to light.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like an unmuzzling of thoughts long kept silent.
meanings.sent5: The unmuzzling of creativity resulted in beautiful art.

meanings.definition: To release from restraint or control
meanings.sent1: The protesters were unmuzzling their voices against injustice.
meanings.sent2: Unmuzzling their potential, they achieved great success.
meanings.sent3: The unmuzzling of the wild horse surprised the spectators.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was an unmuzzling of his inner joy.
meanings.sent5: The unmuzzling of emotions brought a sense of relief.
